metadata.title: CVE-2018-6074 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Failure to apply Mark-of-the-Web in Downloads in Google Chrome prior to65.0.3325.146 allowed a remote attacker to bypass OS level controls via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6074` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '65.0.3325.146-0ubuntu1').
